name: maize silage production | maize silage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19498/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of maize silage (fresh matter) for feed production. This dataset represents both rainfed and irrigated maize production: 89% of the production area is rainfed and the remaining 11% is produced under irrigation. The average weighted yield is 21.35 t/ha*a at a moisture content at storage of 63%, based on yields from 2007 and under the assumption that the yields quoted in the Census of commercial agriculture refer to dry matter yields (Source: Stats SA (2009) Census of commercial agriculture 2007. Available at: http://www.statssa.gov.za/publications/Report-11-02-01/Report-11-02-012007.pdf);;The inputs of seeds, fertilisers, pesticides, silage additives, and irrigation water (weighted average of irrigated and rainfed production) are considered. Compost is applied as organic fertiliser and total mineral N-P2O5-K2O application is 30-12-2 kg/ha*a. Cultivation steps as mowing, tillage, sowing, fertilising, application of pesticides and harvesting are considered. Transport of the harvested yield from the field to the farm (4.5 km) are included. Direct field emissions are calculated.;;Land use change is not accounted in this dataset as maize area harvested in South Africa is shrinking during the period of the last 20 years. Data originate from FAOSTAT.

This activity starts with the harvest of the previous crop. 

This activity ends after 8.42 months storage in a silage bunker.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for South Africa
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset represents both rainfed and irrigated maize production: 89% of the production area is rainfed and the remaining 11% is under irrigation (source: http://www.statssa.gov.za/publications/Report-11-02-01/Report-11-02-012007.pdf).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Modelling is based on interviews with five maize silage producers in South Africa, one in Gauteng, one in Mpumalanga, one in Free State, one in Limpopo and one silage producer in Free State who produces silage but does not cultivate maize. Production area, yields and the ratio of rainfed to irrigated production were obtained from Statistics South Africa (2010) Census of commercial agriculture 2007 Financial and production statistics, Stats SA, Pretoria, South Africa, available at http://www.statssa.gov.za/publications/Report-11-02-01/Report-11-02-012007.pdf

exchanges.description: Maize silage production, South African production, rainfed (89% of production area) and irrigated (11% of production area).

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Candinas et al. (1999), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 - 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.
Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013; 
Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305-314.; Candinas, T.; Golder, E.; Kupper, T.; Besson, J.-M., (1999) Nähr- und Schadstoffe im Kompost, Eigenössische Forschungsanstalt für Agrarökologie und Landbau (FAL) & Institut für Umweltschuzt und Landwirtschaft (IUL), Liebefeld 
UWC Erosion http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed Apr 28, 2015). 
Prasuhn V. (2006) Erfassung der PO4-Austräge für die Ökobilanzierung SALCA Phosphor. Agroscope Reckenholz - Tänikon ART, 20p. Online at http://www.art.admin.ch/themen/00617/00744/index.html?lang=en.
Desaules A. & Studer K. (1993) NABO: Nationales Beobachtungsnetz, Messresultate 1985-1991, Schriftenreihe Umwelt Nr. 200, BUWAL (Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft), Bern; 
Freiermuth R. (2006) Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der Landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz - SALCA-Schwermetall, Forschungsanstalt Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon (ART), 28p
Measured value. Average value, maximum of 1 ploughing per year. Data from interviews with four South African maize silage producers in Gauteng, Mpumalanga, Free State and Limpopo

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Candinas et al. (1999), heavy metal content of plant material and deposition according to Freiermuth (2006), leaching rates according to Wolfensberger & Dinkel (1997),  heavy metal content of the soil according to Keller & Desaules (2001), soil erosion according to Kooman & Critchley; Le Roux at al. (2008); UWC (2015), accumulation factor according to Wilke & Schaub (1986), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m. Source: Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references: Wolfensberger U. & Dinkel F. (1997) Beurteilung nachwachsender Rohstoffe in der Schweiz in den Jahren 1993-1996, FAT und Carbotech, im Auftrag des Bundesamtes für Landwirtschaft, Bern; Desaules A. & Studer K. (1993) NABO: Nationales Beobachtungsnetz, Messresultate 1985-1991, Schriftenreihe Umwelt Nr. 200, BUWAL (Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft), Bern;  Freiermuth R. (2006) Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der Landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz - SALCA-Schwermetall, Forschungsanstalt Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon (ART), 28p;  Candinas, T.; Golder, E.; Kupper, T.; Besson, J.-M., (1999) Nähr- und Schadstoffe im Kompost, Eigenössische Forschungsanstalt für Agrarökologie und Landbau (FAL) & Institut für Umweltschuzt und Landwirtschaft (IUL), Liebefeld
Measured value. References: Data from interviews with three South African maize silage producers in Gauteng, Mpumalanga and Limpopo

exchanges.description: Calculated value

Calculated value: emissions arising from fertiliser use, calculated using the SQCB-NO3 model from Faist Emmenegger et al. (2009). Clay content according to the WFLDB, root depth according to FAO (2011). 
Further references: FAO (2011) Crop water information. Natural Resources and Environment Department, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. Online, accessed February 2011. Available at: http://www.fao.org/nr/water/cropinfo.html.

Calculated value: emissions arising from fertiliser use, calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil erosion according to Kooman & Critchley; Le Roux at al. (2008); UWC (2015), P content in topsoil according to Nemecek, Kägi T. & Blaser S. (2007), enrichment factor for P according to Wilke & Schaub (1996), fraction of eroded soil that reaches river according to Nemecek, Kägi & Blaser (2007).  
Further references: Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013 ISBN 978-953-51-1092-7; Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305-314; UWC Erosion Available online: http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed on Apr 28, 2015); Nemecek, T., Kagi, T., & Blaser, S. (2007). Life Cycle Inventories of Swiss and European Agricultural Production Systems. Final report; Wilke B. & Schaub D. (1996) Phosphatanreicherung bei Bodenerosion. Mitt. Deutsche Bodenkundl. Gesellsch. 79, 435-438.
Calculated value: calculated from N2O emissions according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011).

exchanges.description: Calculated value: 100% of input quantity

Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Candinas et al. (1999), heavy metal content of plant material and deposition according to Freiermuth (2006), leaching rates according to Wolfensberger & Dinkel (1997),  heavy metal content of the soil according to Keller & Desaules (2001), soil erosion according to Kooman & Critchley; Le Roux at al. (2008); UWC (2015), accumulation factor according to Wilke & Schaub (1986), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m. Source: Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references: Wolfensberger U. & Dinkel F. (1997) Beurteilung nachwachsender Rohstoffe in der Schweiz in den Jahren 1993-1996, FAT und Carbotech, im Auftrag des Bundesamtes für Landwirtschaft, Bern; Desaules A. & Studer K. (1993) NABO: Nationales Beobachtungsnetz, Messresultate 1985-1991, Schriftenreihe Umwelt Nr. 200, BUWAL (Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft), Bern;  Freiermuth R. (2006) Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der Landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz - SALCA-Schwermetall, Forschungsanstalt Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon (ART), 28p;  Candinas, T.; Golder, E.; Kupper, T.; Besson, J.-M., (1999) Nähr- und Schadstoffe im Kompost, Eigenössische Forschungsanstalt für Agrarökologie und Landbau (FAL) & Institut für Umweltschuzt und Landwirtschaft (IUL), Liebefeld

Calculated value: emissions arising from fertiliser use, calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). P2O5 content of manure according to Flisch et al. (2009).
Further references: Flisch, R., Sinaj, S., Charles, R. & Richner, W., 2009. GRUDAF 2009 - Grundlagen für die Düngung im Acker und Futterbau. Agrarforschung 16 (2), 197.
Measured value. References: Data from interviews with three South African maize silage producers in Gauteng, Mpumalanga and Limpopo

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: calculated according to Nemecek und Schnetzer (2011). Soil heavy metal contents according to Keller & Desaules (2001), erosion average value according to Kooman & Critchley (2013), Le Roux et al. (2008) and UWC Erosion (2015), accumulation factor according to Prasuhn (2006), erosion factor: 0.05, since surface waters between agricultural fields are rare and the distance to the next river or lake is greater than 100 m according to Freiermuth (2006), heavy metal content of inorganic fertilisers according to Desaules & Struder (1993), heavy-metal contents of organic fertilisers according to Candinas et al. (1999), deposition and content of seeds according to Freiermuth (2006). 
Further references:  
Keller T. & Desaules A. (2001) Böden der Schweiz: Schadstoffgehalte und Orientierungswerte (1990 - 1996). Umwelt-Materialien Nr. 139. Bern: Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft BUWAL.
Kooman, G.; Critchley, W. R. S. GIS-Assisted Modelling of Soil Erosion in a South African Catchment: Evaluating the USLE and SLEMSA Approach. In Water Resources Planning, Development and Management; Breetzke, G. D., Ed.; InTech, 2013; 
Le Roux, J. J.; Morgenthal, T. L.; Malherbe, J.; Pretorius, D. J.; Sumner, P. D. Water erosion prediction at a national scale for South Africa. Water SA 2008, 34, 305-314.; Candinas, T.; Golder, E.; Kupper, T.; Besson, J.-M., (1999) Nähr- und Schadstoffe im Kompost, Eigenössische Forschungsanstalt für Agrarökologie und Landbau (FAL) & Institut für Umweltschuzt und Landwirtschaft (IUL), Liebefeld 
UWC Erosion http://www.botany.uwc.ac.za/envfacts/facts/erosion.htm (accessed Apr 28, 2015). 
Prasuhn V. (2006) Erfassung der PO4-Austräge für die Ökobilanzierung SALCA Phosphor. Agroscope Reckenholz - Tänikon ART, 20p. Online at http://www.art.admin.ch/themen/00617/00744/index.html?lang=en.
Desaules A. & Studer K. (1993) NABO: Nationales Beobachtungsnetz, Messresultate 1985-1991, Schriftenreihe Umwelt Nr. 200, BUWAL (Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft), Bern; 
Freiermuth R. (2006) Modell zur Berechnung der Schwermetallflüsse in der Landwirtschaftlichen Ökobilanz - SALCA-Schwermetall, Forschungsanstalt Agroscope Reckenholz-Tänikon (ART), 28p
Calculated value: 100% of input quantity
Calculated value: 100% of input quantity
Calculated value: 100% of input quantity
Measured value. once per year. Data from interviews with four South African maize silage producers in Gauteng, Mpumalanga, Free State and Limpopo

flow.name: Ammonia
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of maize silage is calculated to be circa 2.22E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'anthranilic acid', 'atrazine', 'boron trifluoride', 'metolachlor', 'molybdenum trioxide', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified', 'zinc oxide'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.44E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description:
Measured value.  Weighted average: 11% of the total production area is irrigated with centre pivot irrigation systems, using groundwater. Average water consumption on irrigated land: 7248 m3/ha/a. The remaining 89% is rainfed. 
Further references: Data from interviews with two South African maize silage producers in Mpumalanga and Limpopo.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'maize silage' is calculated to be circa 2.11E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'gypsum, mineral', 'lime', 'magnesium oxide', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.23E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
